bugs.title: CVE-2018-10528 mingw-LibRaw: LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-10528 mingw-LibRaw: LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-10528 LibRaw: Stack-based buffer overflow in libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() allows for potential code execution

long_desc.thetext:
LibRaw through version 0.18.9 is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow in the libraw_cxx.cpp:utf2char() function. An attacker could exploit this to cause a crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.


Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/issues/144

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/commit/895529fc2f2eb8bc633edd6b04b5b237eb4db564

Created LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1574321]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574322]


Created mingw-LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574319]
This was fixed in LibRaw 0.19.0-Beta4 and 0.18.10.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-10528

bugs.title: CVE-2018-10529 mingw-LibRaw: LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-10529 mingw-LibRaw: LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-10529 LibRaw: Out-of-bounds read in X3F property table list functionality in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
LibRaw through version 0.18.9 is vulnerable to an out-of-bounds read in the X3F property table list implementation in libraw_x3f.cpp and libraw_cxx.cpp. An attacker could exploit this to cause a crash via crafted file.


Upstream Issue:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/issues/144

Upstream Patch:

https://github.com/LibRaw/LibRaw/commit/f0c505a3e5d47989a5f69be2d0d4f250af6b1a6c

Created LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1574329]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574326]


Created mingw-LibRaw tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1574327]
This was fixed in LibRaw 0.19 Beta-4.

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-10529
